info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 19 at 9:14PM CDT until April 19 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LYON COUNTY... At 913 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Americus, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Americus. This includes Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 134 and 137. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
